newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Cyprus unity talks end with no date for next round.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus unity talks end with no date for next round.

text.p: Deadlocked Cyprus unity talks in Switzerland ended on Friday with no date fixed for a further round, Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash said.

Denktash told Reuters: "The talks ended around noon. There's no date for a new round." He gave no details after his fifth day of negotiations with Cyrpiot President Glafcos Clerides and U.N mediator Diego Cordovez at an isolated hotel in the village Glion, near Montreux.
The three parties planned separate news conferences on Friday afternoon -- Denktash at 2:30 p.m. (1230 GMT), Clerides an hour later and Cordovev an hour after Clerides.
Officials close to Cordovez said the U.N., which is keen to keep momentum going, was likely to issue a middle-of-the-way statement accommodating both sides' ever entrenched positions.
The two sides have accused each other of blocking a deal and retreating to entrenched positions they have held for over 20 years.
Greek and Turkish Cypriot officials agreed earlier on Friday as the meeting in Glion drew to a close that the session was a failure and the atmosphere worse than July`s opening round in New York.

Diplomats fear the eastern Mediterranean island, a political football in the regional cold war between Greece and Turkey, will end up being more divided than ever if the talks fail amid a buildup of arms on both sides.
